member.name: T:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils
member.summary: The JsonDataUtils class contains a variety of utility functions that will be used by various classes in the Tiferix.Json library.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertFromJsonDataType(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a data type stored in a Tiferix.Json file into its associated .Net data type. All Tiferix.Json data types will be stored as Json strings with a property name of "DataType".

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertToJsonDataType(System.Type)
member.summary: Converts a .Net data type into a format that can be stored in a Tiferix.Json file. All Tiferix.Json data types will be stored as Json strings with a property name of "DataType".
member.param: .Net data type to convert into a Tiferix.Json compatible data type.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertToADODataSetDateTimeEnum(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a DateSetDateTime value that is contained in the Tiferix.Json format into a DataSetDateTime .Net object which is used by the DateTimeMode property of ADO.Net DataTables.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertEscapeChar(System.String)
member.summary: Converts an escape character represented as a string (with '\\' characters) into actual .Net escape character represented as a single char value. All escape characters will be stored as strings in Tiferix.Json files.
member.param: The string value to convert to a .Net escape character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertDataFromJson(System.String,System.Type,System.Runtime.Serialization.DateTimeFormat)
member.summary: Converts a data value stored in a Tiferix.Json file into the appropriate .Net value according to the data type of the specified value. Since all values are stored as strings in Json, certain data conversions and string decoding will be necessary for certain formats of data, such as binary and date/time types of data.
member.param: The Tiferix.Json data value string to convert into its .Net value that matches its data type.
The .Net data type that the Tiferix.Json data value will be converted to.
The DateTimeFormat that DateTime, TimeSpan and other date related types are used for the Tiferix.Json data value.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.ConvertDateTimeOffsetFromJson(System.String,System.Runtime.Serialization.DateTimeFormat)
member.summary: Converts a Tiferix.Json DateTimeOffset value into the equivalent .Net DateTimeOffset value. The Tiferix.Json DateTimeOffset will be stored as a concatenated Date/Time and TimeSpan value which will be used to generate the DateTimeOffset value.
member.param: Tiferix.Json DateTimeOffset value to convert to .Net DateTimeOffset value.
Date/Time format used for the Date/Time portion of the Tiferix.Json DateTimeOffset value.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.IsEscapeChar(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if the Tiferix.Json string value is a valid .Net escape character. Escape characters in Tiferix.Json files will be stored as string literals (with two '\\') and must be converted into valid .Net escape character char values.
member.param: The Tiferix.Json string to examine.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataUtils.IsAnonymousType(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks to see if the .Net data type is an anonymous data type.
member.param: .Net data type.

member.name: T:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter
member.summary: The JsonDataWriter class is used to write data from .Net objects, DataSets and Tiferix.Json schema objects to various Tieferix.Json data and schema files. This class will handle the the formatting and writing of data into a Tiferix.Json files, including object and array blocks, identation, spacing and the processing and conversion of various .Net data types into serialized Tiferix.Json strings that match the data type.

member.name: F:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.m_iNestLevel
member.summary: The current level of nesting of Json object/array block in the current JsonDataWriter when AutoIdent mode is active.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The underlying data stream used by the JsonDataWriter class to write all Tiferix.Json data output.
The character encoding used for writing output to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The default character encoding is UTF8.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The underlying data stream used by the JsonDataWriter class to write all Tiferix.Json data output.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.InitializeDataWriter(System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Initializes the JsonDataWriter class with all default formatting, encoding and data conversion settings, as well as creates a new stream writer object. The streamwriter will be used to write all Tiferix.Json string data to the underlying data stream used by the class.
member.param: The underlying data stream used by the JsonDataWriter class to write all Tiferix.Json data output.
The character encoding used for writing output to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The default character encoding is UTF8.

member.summary: Public implementation of Dispose pattern callable by consumers.

member.summary: Protected implementation of Dispose pattern.

member.summary: Destructor

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.BaseStream
member.summary: The underlying data stream used by the JsonDataWriter class to write all Tiferix.Json data output.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the current position of the underlying data stream of the JsonDataWriter class.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.Close
member.summary: Closes the JsonDataWriter's StreamWriter object and the underlying data stream.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.FieldDelimiter
member.summary: The character used for separating invididual fields of a table in the Json data files. The default fielf delimiter for separating table fields is a comma character.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.Encoding
member.summary: The character encoding to be used for the Json data files, which are always stored in string format. This will be the character encoding used for the entire Json data file. The default character encoding is UTF8.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: The format to use for storing Date/Time values in the Json data file.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.DateTimeZone
member.summary: Indicates which time zone will be associated with the Date/Time values stored in the Json data file.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.Culture
member.summary: The specific culture or locale associated with the data stored in the Json data file.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.AutoIdent
member.summary: Indicates if the JsonDataWriter class will automatically handling the identation of the Json data as it is written to the Json data file. If AutoIdent is set to true, then the JsonDataWriter class will keep track of the identation of the various nested blocks of data and handling the identation of the various nested blocks will not be neccessary. AutoIdent is enabled by default. NOTE: Certain format restrictions apply, when AutoIdent mode is set to true.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.IdentSpacing
member.summary: The number of identation characters (usually a space) to use to ident each line of data in the Json data file. Each time an identation string is written, it will use the number of identation spaces specified in this property. The default number of indentation spaces is 2.

member.name: P:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.IdentChar
member.summary: The character used which will represent an identation space in the Json data file. Each time an identation string is written, this character will be written to the Json data file, using the number of identation spaces specified in the class. The default identation character is a space.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.GetIdentString(System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an identation string using either the IdentSpacing and IdentChar properties of the JsonDataWriter class or can optionally generate an identation string using the identation character and spacing parameters of the function. This function will also be called internally when the AutoIdent feature is enabled and will keep track of the current nesting level/position of the Json data file.
member.param: Identation character. This setting will override the IdentChar property of the class if set.
Identating spacing. This setting will override the IdentSpacing property of the class is set.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteBeginObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the opening brace symbol "{" representing the start of a new Json object block to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
member.param: Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the opening brace symbol character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteEndObject(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the closing brace symbol "}" representing the end of a Json object block to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
member.param: Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the closing brace symbol character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteBeginArray(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the opening bracket symbol "[" representing the start of a new Json array block to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
member.param: Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the opening bracket symbol character.
Indicates if the array block will start on a new line.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteEndArray(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the closing bracket symbol "]" representing the end of a Json array block to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
member.param: Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the closing bracket symbol character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteIndent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an indentation string to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The identation string will consist of the identation character and spacing set in the JsonDataWriter class. If the NumSpaces parameter is set, it will override the identation spacing settings of the class.
member.param: The number of characters (usually spaces) to write in the identation string. If this parameter is set it willl override the IdentSpacing setting of the class.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteNewLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes one or more new line characters to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The default number of lines written is 1.
member.param: Number of new line characters to write to the stream.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WritePropertyName(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the name of the Tiferix.Json property to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property will be written in the aprropriate Json format of "PropertyName": {data value}. NOTE: A space will be appended after the colon symbol of the property.
member.param: The name of the property.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteFieldDelimiter(System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a field delimiter and optionally a new line character after the delimiter to Tiferix.Json data stream. If the cDelimiter parameter is not set, then the FieldDelimiter setting of the JsonDataWriter class will be written as the field delimiter to the stream.
member.param: The character used as the field delimiter. If this paramter is set it will override the FieldDelimiter character setting of the class.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the field delimiter character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteFieldDelimiter(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a field delimiter and optionally a new line character after the delimiter to Tiferix.Json data stream. This version of the function will write the FieldDelimiter character setting of the JsonDataWriter class to the stream.
member.param: Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the field delimiter character.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteNumericValue(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This internal function will be used to write all primitive .Net numeric data values to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The numeric values will be converted to a string and written as a Json formatted numeric value to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: The numeric value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteNumericValue(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This internal function will be used to write both the name of the property and its associated value for all primitive .Net numeric data values to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " {data value}. Numeric values will be converted to a string and written as a Json formatted numeric value to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: The name of the property.
The numeric value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteStringValue(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This internal function will be used to write all .Net string data values to the Tiferix.Json data stream. Any data type that needs to be outputted in string format in the Json file to a string (including dates and even binarydata) will be passed as a string to this function and then written as a Json formatted string value to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the string value to the data stream.
member.param: The string formatted value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteStringValue(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This internal function will be used to write oth the name of the property and its associated value for all .Net string data values to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " "string value". Any data type that needs to be outputted in string format in the Json file to a string (including dates and even binarydata) will be passed as a string to this function and then written as a Json formatted string value to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the string value to the data stream.
member.param: The name of the property.
The string formatted value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteDataValue(System.Char,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Char values can either be written as Json formatted string or numeric values. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: Char value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.

If the SurroundQuotes parameter is set to true, then the char value will be written as a Json formatted string with quotes surrounded by the char value. If set to false, then the char will be written as a single character value to the stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.summary: Writes a .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. DateTime values will use the DateTimeFormat settings set in the JsonDataWriter class to serialize the DateTime values as Json formatted strings. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the numeric value string to the data stream.
member.param: DateTime value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteDataValue(System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a nullable .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Char values can either be written as Json formatted string or numeric values. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: Nullable Char value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.

If the SurroundQuotes parameter is set to true, then the char value will be written as a Json formatted string with quotes surrounded by the char value. If set to false, then the char will be written as a single character value to the stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteDataValue(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a nullable .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. DateTime values will use the DateTimeFormat settings set in the JsonDataWriter class to serialize the DateTime values as Json formatted strings. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value to the data stream.
member.param: Nullable DateTime value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.summary: Writes a .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. If the data value is passed as an object to the WriteDataValue function, then the data type of the object first will be detected. Once the data type is detected, the data then will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value to the data stream.
member.param: Data value of supported .Net data type passed as an object to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WriteDataValue(System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a binary chunk of data to the Tiferix.Json data stream. Because of the nature of how binary data is stored in string files, it will be necessary to use a Base64 encoded string to store the binary data. All binary values will be converted into Base64 encoded strings, which can then be encoded back into .Net byte arrays. Base64 encoding guarantees no loss of data of the binary data in the Json data file. Once converted into Base64 encoded strings by the JsonDataWriterClass, the data will be then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value to the data stream.
member.param: Binary value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WritePropDataValue(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes both the name of the property and its associated nullable .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " {data value}. Char values can either be written as Json formatted string or numeric values. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: The name of the property.
Char value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.

If the SurroundQuotes parameter is set to true, then the char value will be written as a Json formatted string with quotes surrounded by the char value. If set to false, then the char will be written as a single character value to the stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.summary: Writes both the name of the property and its associated nullable .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " {data value}. DateTime values will use the DateTimeFormat settings set in the JsonDataWriter class to serialize the DateTime values as Json formatted strings. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. The data value will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WritePropDataValue(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes both the name of the property and its associated .Net data value to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " {data value}. If the data value is passed as an object to the WritePropDataValue function, then the data type of the object first will be detected. Once the data type is detected, the data then will be converted by the JsonDataWriter into the appropriate Json format and then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Null values will be written according to the Json standards as the value of 'null', without quotes. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value string to the data stream.
member.param: The name of the property.
Data value of supported .Net data type passed as an object to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).

member.name: M:Tiferix.Json.Tools.JsonDataWriter.WritePropDataValue(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes both the name of the property and its associated binary chunk of data to the Tiferix.Json data stream. The property name and value will be written in the proper Json format of "PropertyName: " {data value}. Because of the nature of how binary data is stored in string files, it will be necessary to use a Base64 encoded string to store the binary data. All binary values will be converted into Base64 encoded strings, which can then be encoded back into .Net byte arrays. Base64 encoding guarantees no loss of data of the binary data in the Json data file. Once converted into Base64 encoded strings by the JsonDataWriterClass, the data will be then written to the Tiferix.Json stream. Optionally, a field delimiter and newline character can be written after the value to the data stream.
member.param: The name of the property.
Binary value to write to the Tiferix.Json data stream.
Indicates if a field delimiter character will be written to the stream after the data value.
Indicates if a newline character will be written to the stream after the data value and field delimiter character (if a delimiter is used).
